alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 2:09PM PDT until November 05 at 9:03PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. .The heavy rain has come to an end early Saturday morning. The Cowlitz River at Randle has crested and has fallen below flood stage at Randle. The warning will remain in place until flood water has sufficiently moved out of the area. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Cowlitz River At Randle. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, the Cowlitz River will spill into low fields along river from the vicinity of Randle downstream through Riffe Lake...with shallow water over a few roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river crested this morning late this morning and will continue to recede. The warning will remain in place until the flood waters have fully gone down. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 915 PM PDT.
